Home → Recommendations & reviews → Music → New music for November 2015

New music for November 2015

Written by Brandon King · Published Nov 2, 2015

Alone in the universe by Jeff Lynne’s ELO

Jeff Lynne’s new album is the first new ELO music for 15 years. As with ELO’s previous chart-topping albums, Lynne continues to serve as ELO’s producer, songwriter, arranger, lead singer and guitarist with longtime ELO partner Richard Tandy. We have had people asking about this one for months so place your reservation now!

25 by Adele

Justin Bieber, Ellie Goulding and One Direction have moved release dates to avoid Adele’s 25. Get your reservation in now!

Delirium by Ellie Goulding

Third studio album from the all conquering Ellie Goulding. Follow-up to 2012’s Halcyon.

Dark sky island by Enya

75 million sales, four Grammy Awards, six World Music Awards, an Ivor Novello, an Oscar nomination, a Golden Globe nomination and seven studio albums. Enya’s latest album is as hypnotic and otherworldly as you would expect.

Montage of Heck by Kurt Cobain

A collection of demos written and recorded by Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain and released as a companion piece to the documentary of the same name. It’s a fascinating glimpse into the man behind the image. It is aimed at Nirvana fanatics but there are moments of more general interest. Cobain’s admiration for John Lennon is well documented and there is a version of the Beatles And I Love Her. There are also moments that nod towards early 1970’s Paul McCartney. By no means essential but an interesting curio.

The best of the cutting edge 1965-1966 by Bob Dylan

This double CD features the best of Bob Dylan’s unreleased studio recordings from 1965 and 1966, and includes alternate versions of songs such as Like A Rolling Stone, Desolation Row, Visions Of Johanna and Highway 61 Revisited.

Brandon King

I work in the Suffolk Libraries Stock Team
